p:
There is another migration path with a low E
mig (only 0.19 eV, 96 h′–48 g–96 h′ migration path) between two 96 h′ sites through the 48 g site, as shown in Supplementary Fig. S3(c). However, as shown in Supplementary Fig. S4, this migration path is the same as the 48 g–96 h′ migration path and is localized, so that the migration of O
i through the whole cell cannot occur only through this migration path. The 96 h′–O–96 h′ migration path is additionally needed to connect through the whole cell, as mentioned above.
